snippet: Officials see an opening to argue for cuts in bases and health and weapons programs that have long been in President Obama’s sights.
abstract: Anxious Pentagon officials who are facing $46 billion in mandatory budget cuts see opening to argue for deep reductions in military bases, healthcare and weapons programs that have long been in Pres Obama's sights; some say reductions, if done smartly, could easily exceed those mandated by sequestration and leave room for areas where more money will be required.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and THOM SHANKER

lead_paragraph: Officials see an opening to argue for cuts in bases and health and weapons programs that have long been in President Obama’s sights.

headline.seo: Mandatory Cuts Could Open Path to Deeper Defense Trims
headline.main: Cuts Give Obama Path to Create Leaner Military
headline.print_headline: Cuts Give Obama Path to Create Leaner Military

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
